Description: Upper torso of a sandstone statue of Amenhotep III bearing the beard, lappets and crossed hands holding ankh-symbols.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Merenptah, Originally stood at the Temple of Amenhotep III, said to have stood in front of the pedestals of colossal jackals.
Curator's comments: EA69050+EA69051+EA69052 are three fragments of a sandstone Osiride statue of AIII
Bibliographic references: Adams 1977 / Egyptian objects in the Victoria and Albert Museum (p.6, fig.6,7,8,9; p.18)
Exhibition history: 2022 - 2023 8 Dec – 27 Aug, Canberra, National Museum of Australia, Goddess PROPOSED 2023 – 2024 5 Oct - 28 Jan, Barcelona, Caixaforum, Goddess – PROPOSED 2024 29 Feb – 9 Jun, Madrid, Caixaforum , Goddess – PROPOSED 2024 10 Jul – 27 Oct, Seville, Caixaforum, Goddess – PROPOSED 2024 -2025 27 Nov – 16 Mar, Zaragoza, Caixaforum, Goddess – PROPOSED 2025 22 Apr – 17 Aug, Palma, Caixaforum, Goddess – PROPOSED
